name: Multisystemic Tauopathy with Parkinsonism
chief_complaint: I've been forgetting things more often, my hands shake, and I feel like I'm moving slower every day.
prognosis: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder with median survival of 7-10 years from symptom onset. Motor symptoms typically less responsive to dopaminergic therapy than in Parkinson's disease.
description: A rare neurodegenerative disorder characterized by abnormal tau protein accumulation affecting multiple brain systems. Presents with overlapping features of parkinsonism and frontotemporal dementia, distinguished from typical Parkinson's disease by early cognitive decline, poor response to dopaminergic therapy, and specific tau pathology on post-mortem examination.
